title: 109_hr6230
content: The Act may be cited as the "Desalination Energy Consumption Reduction Act of 2006". Definitions are provided in the Act. The "Desalination Energy Consumption Reduction Act of 2006" defines a qualified desalination facility as one that produces desalinated seawater, brackish groundwater, or surface water with over 1000 milligrams per liter total dissolved solids, owned by a State, Indian tribe, or corporation providing municipal water service. The "Desalination Energy Consumption Reduction Act of 2006" defines a qualified desalination facility as one that produces desalinated water for sale using the best available technology as determined by the Secretary of Energy. The terms "Indian tribe" and "State" are defined within the Act. The "Desalination Energy Consumption Reduction Act of 2006" defines a qualified desalination facility as one that produces desalinated water for sale using the best available technology as determined by the Secretary of Energy. The Act also includes provisions for Desalinated Water Energy Consumption Reduction Incentive Payments. The Secretary will provide incentive payments to owners of qualified desalination facilities to promote energy-efficient technology. Payments require a written agreement by the end of fiscal year 2018 and can be made for up to 10 years, starting from the facility's first use and ending by September 30, 2028. The Secretary will provide incentive payments to owners of qualified desalination facilities based on energy conservation below established benchmarks. Payments will be made for up to 10 years, ending by September 30, 2028, ranging from 30 cents per 1,000 gallons of potable water produced. The Secretary will provide incentive payments to owners of qualified desalination facilities based on energy conservation below established benchmarks. Payments will range from 30 cents to 90 cents per 1,000 gallons of potable water produced, depending on the energy savings demonstrated by the facility. Adjustments for inflation will be made to payments starting in 2009. To receive a grant, the facility must submit an application with specified information and assurances, including a commitment to use the financial benefit for the rate payers. Additionally, no more than 60 percent of the funds available in a fiscal year will be allocated by the Secretary under this program. The Secretary will provide incentive payments to owners of qualified desalination facilities based on energy conservation. Priority will be given to projects using innovative technologies, renewable energy, providing regional water supply benefits, supporting national defense activities, reducing water supply disruption risks, and minimizing damage to marine life. The authority provided in this section is subject to Budget Act Compliance and an authorization of appropriations of $200,000,000 for fiscal years 2008 through 2018.
